title: Identifying the Correct Hypotheses
question_text:
Hormones can be used to increase the weight gain of specific types of poultry.
In an experiment using $15$ chickens, five different doses of growth hormone ($0$, $0.1$, $0.2$, $0.3$, and $0.4$ mg/kg) were injected into chickens (three for each dose) and the subsequent weight gain was recorded. An experimenter plots the data and finds the relationship to be linear. The regression output is below.
It is suspected that weight gain should increase with dose. Appropriate null and alternative hypotheses to test the slope are:
